data.title: A Few Issues
data.text:
My wife and I stopped in for an after dinner drink on a Friday night.  The place was almost completely empty.  We were seated promptly and provided drink menus.  They have a decent selection of wines, although we did not recognize most of them, and my wife selected a decent pinot noir.  I, however, had to argue about what drink I was allowed to order.  I began by asking for calvados, my usual after dinner drink and they do not carry it.  The bartender/waiter tried to turn me on to a brandy that cost $17 a glass by providing me a small sample.  I next decided that I would just have a glass of prosecco.  The waiter/bartender essentially refused to serve me the prosecco and continued to try to describe what exactly it was I was looking for in a drink.  Trying to not stand up and walk out, I humored him and allowed him to fix me a drink.  He brings me a "white lady" which was actually very refreshing, but not really what I was looking for.  

A few points:

1. The place was really empty for a Friday night and didnt seem to be picking up.
2. Try letting your patrons decide what they want.  I really dont appreciate having someone refuse my drink order then try to talk me into something I have no interest in.  In retrospect, we should have left at this point but since it was my wife's birthday, I decided to just go with it.

data.title: Swanky place!
data.text: The staff and management are truly exceptional.  They have some very interesting drink specials which make this a great place for happy hour with friends and colleagues.   We enjoyed drinks and dinner with friends and will definitely be back.  The menu is somewhat limited with one fish entrée and no chicken entrée.  My husband is always happy with beef, but I tend to look for alternatives.  I must say that I chose the filet and it was delicious.  This would be a nice location for a small celebration, but space is limited, so call ahead.
